title: Identify the Variables
text: Consider the number of moles present in each vessel and what impact it has on the heat capacity. More moles might imply a greater change in energy under a constant heating process.

title: Use the Heat Capacity Formula
text: Recall the formula for calculating heat. For a given amount of substance, heat Q can be represented as $$Q=nC_{v\Delta T}$$, where $$n$$ is moles, $$C_v$$ is specific heat capacity at constant volume and ΔT is the change in temperature.

title: Consider Specific Heat Capacities
text: Different gases have different specific heat capacities at constant volume $$C_v$$. For ideal gases like He, $$H_2$$, $$N_2$$, and Ne, these values differ. Determine the $$C_v$$ values for these gases to understand their heating behavior.

title: Calculate Heat for Each Vessel
text:
Using the given values and understanding from the hints, calculate the heat absorbed by each vessel:
$$1$$. $$Q_1=2C_{v,H,2\Delta T}$$
$$2$$. $$Q_2=4C_{v,N,2\Delta T}$$
$$3$$. $$Q_3=2C_{v,He\Delta T}$$
$$4$$. $$Q_4=1C_{v,Ne\Delta T}$$

title: Analyze the Expressed Relationships
text: Based on the calculated heat values, if Q_{s1} < Q_{s2} then vessel $$1$$ absorbs less heat than vessel $$2$$ and so forth. Formulate the final ranking order.
